title: Andhra Pradesh considering Australia-like social media ban for kids: Nara Lokesh
byline: India’s southern state of Andhra Pradesh is studying Australia’s ban on children under 16 years of age from using social media, its minister in charge of technology and human resources said Tuesday.

title: Businessman held over sexual abuse of 36 minors
byline: A businessman alleged to have sexually abused 36 children below the age of 18 has been arrested by the Bureau for the Prevention of Abuse of Children and Women, police said.

title: CIABOC will probe sugar scam: Minister
byline: The Committee to Investigate Allegations on Bribery or Corruption (CIABOC) will carry out a probe into the sugar scam of 2020, Minister of Public Security Ananda Wijepala told Parliament today.

title: MILCO proves state institutions can be rebuilt by ending corruption: Prime Minister
byline: Prime Minister Dr. Harini Amarasuriya said that MILCO has demonstrated that state institutions can be transformed into strong and profitable entities by eliminating fraud and corruption and ensuring proper management.

title: Why do Sri Lankan passports fail to scan at e-gates at international airports?
byline: Several local passengers have brought to the attention of the Daily Mirror that the Sri Lankan passport usually fails to scan in the e-gates at immigration departments at international airports, and Sri Lankan passengers are then diverted to the immigration counter for a manual check.

title: New e-gates at BIA spark chaos
byline: Passengers arriving at Bandaranaike International Airport (BIA) were left inconvenienced and delayed as Sri Lanka’s newly installed automated border control (ABC) e-gates failed to scan passports efficiently, raising questions about the readiness of the high-tech system funded with US$8.4 million by the Japanese government.

title: China bans hidden car door handles over safety concerns
byline: China has banned hidden door handles on electric vehicles (EVs), making it the first country to stop the use of the controversial designs that were made popular by multi-billionaire Elon Musk’s Tesla.

title: US and India reach trade deal, Trump says after Modi call
byline: US President Donald Trump announced that he agreed to a trade deal with India’s Prime Minister Narendra Modi, where the US will lower tariffs on goods from India to 18% from 25%.

title: Appeal Court dismisses Balangoda Kassapa Thera’s writ petition
byline: The Court of Appeal today decided to dismiss the writ applications filed by two Buddhist monks, including Ven. Balangoda Kassapa Thera, who challenged the legality of the remand order made by the Trincomalee Magistrate’s Court in connection with the placement of a Buddha statue in Trincomalee.

title: Suspect arrested over money laundering linked to drug proceeds
byline: A 44-year-old resident of Hanwella has been arrested by the Illegal Assets Investigation Division over suspected money laundering activities.

title: Thundershowers with severe lightning expected in several areas
byline: Thundershowers accompanied by severe lightning are likely to occur at several places in the Sabaragamuwa Province and in the Kalutara, Galle and Matara districts, the Department of Meteorology said.

title: Strong start to 2026: Customs January revenue exceeds estimates
byline: Sri Lanka Customs (SLC) has recorded a strong start to 2026, generating Rs. 232,558 million in revenue in January significantly surpassing the estimated target of Rs. 160,242 million.

title: Woman hits cop with shoe after court orders child handed over to husband
byline: A woman, apparently aggrieved by a court order to hand over the eight-year-old child in her custody to her husband, has hit a police officer with one of her shoes within the Point Pedro court premises.

title: GMOA strike worsens, patients in the lurch
byline: The Government Medical Officers’ Association (GMOA) has decided to intensify the ongoing trade union action, leaving thousands of patients struggling to access healthcare.

title: Around 200 applications received for SriLankan Airlines CEO’s post: Deputy Minister
byline: Around 200 applications have been received for the post of Chief Executive Officer of SriLankan  Airlines, Deputy Minister of Ports and Civil Aviation Janitha Ruwan Kodithuwakku told Parliament today.

title: Country’s foreign reserves increased up to USD 6.8 billion by December 31: Deputy Minister
byline: The foreign reserves of the country have increased up to USD 6.8 billion by December 31, 2025, Deputy Minister of Economic Development Nishantha Jayaweera said today.

title: CEB recovers over Rs. 90 million from fraudulent electricity users in 2025
byline: The Ceylon Electricity Board (CEB) has successfully recovered more than Rs. 90 million from individuals and businesses who obtained electricity illegally during 2025, officials said.

title: Two women arrested for intimidating lawyers at Nugegoda Court
byline: The Police have arrested two female suspects in connection with the criminal intimidation of two lawyers and an attack on their vehicle following proceedings at the Nugegoda Magistrate’s Court.

title: 40.3 per cent of Sri Lankans still “offline” in 2025
byline: Sri Lanka’s internet users stood at 13.9 million last year, an increase of 1.5 million since 2024. It, indicates that 40.3 per cent of the population in Sri Lanka still do not use the internet in their day-to-day life, according to a report by Datareportal.

title: Popular actor Hemal Ranasinghe arrested
byline: Renowned actor Hemal Ranasinghe surrendered to Wellawatte Police this morning over an alleged assault dating back to January 8 at Havelock City.

title: Namal arrives at CID to give statement over organized crime investigation
byline: Sri Lanka Podujana Peramuna (SLPP) National Organizer and Parliamentarian Namal Rajapaksa arrived at the Criminal Investigation Department (CID) today to provide a statement in connection with ongoing investigations into “Kehelbaddara Padme,” a suspected member of an organized crime syndicate.

title: Grade 6 module will be implemented without changes in 2027: PM
byline: The Grade Six module will be implemented without changes in 2027, Prime Minister Harini Amarasuriya told Parliament today.

title: Shiranthi Rajapaksa appears before FCID
byline: Shiranthi Rajapaksa, the wife of former President Mahinda Rajapaksa, arrived at the Financial Crimes Investigation Division (FCID) this morning to record a statement regarding alleged financial irregularities linked to the Siriliya funds.

title: Modi ally proposes social media ban for India’s teens as global debate grows
byline: An ally of Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi has proposed a bill to ban social media for children, as the world’s biggest market for Meta and YouTube joins a global debate on the impact of social media on young people’s health and safety.

title: Cash demand defies SL’s cashless drive
byline: Sri Lanka’s sharp surge in currency withdrawals during the festive season conceals a more persistent dependence on cash that now contrasts with the government’s renewed push towards a ‘cashless economy’.

title: Pakistan calls for new global cricket body, says ICC ‘hostage to Indian political interests’
byline: Pakistan’s Defense Minister Khawaja Asif called for a new global cricket governing body on Tuesday, saying that the International Cricket Council (ICC) has become hostage to Indian political interests amid a fresh row between the neighbors ahead of the T20 World Cup 2026.

title: CC approves Samudika Jayaratne as Auditor General
byline: The Constitutional Council today approved Samudika Jayaratne as the new Auditor General.

title: Fire breaks out in Tehran shopping centre, state media reports
byline: A massive fire broke at a bazaar west of the Iranian capital, state media reports, although the cause of the blaze was unclear.

title: Global gold surge sends local prices soaring
byline: A fresh rally in the global gold market has triggered a sharp spike in gold prices in Sri Lanka, pushing local rates to new highs within a single day.

title: Namal leaves CID after four-hour statement
byline: Sri Lanka Podujana Peramuna (SLPP) National Organiser and Parliamentarian Namal Rajapaksa left the Criminal Investigation Department (CID) a short while ago after recording a statement for more than four hours.

title: Cabinet approves Renewable Energy Resources Development Plan 2025–2030
byline: In line with the National Policy on Renewable Energy, the Cabinet has approved the Renewable Energy Resources Development Plan 2025–2030, aimed at meeting 70 per cent of Sri Lanka’s national electricity demand from renewable energy sources by 2030 and achieving carbon neutrality by 2050.

title: Shiranthi Rajapaksa leaves FCID after four-hour statement
byline: Shiranthi Rajapaksa, wife of former President Mahinda Rajapaksa, left the Financial Crimes Investigation Division (FCID) today after recording a statement for nearly four hours regarding alleged financial irregularities linked to the Siriliya funds.

title: Cabinet approves MoU with Finland to establish political consultation mechanism
byline: The Cabinet has approved a proposal to sign a Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) between Sri Lanka and Finland to establish a formal political consultation mechanism, Cabinet spokesman and Minister Nalinda Jayatissa said.

title: Government aiming at three million tourist arrivals in 2026: PM
byline: Prime Minister Harini Amarasuriya said today that the government is aiming at three million tourist arrivals in 2026.

title: Government considering allowing vehicle imports under retired high-ranking government official permits
byline: The government is holding discussions on allowing vehicle imports for high-ranking government officials who have received vehicle permits on their retirement, Deputy Minister of Economic Development Nishantha Jayaweera said today.

title: MCC changes Laws of Cricket to permit previously ’illegal’ bats
byline: Changes are to be made to the Laws of Cricket to permit bats previously deemed illegal in an effort to make the game affordable for amateur players amid the rising cost of English willow.

title: New women-only pink floor and spa at Sofia Hotel
byline: Sofia Colombo City Hotel yesterday launched its women-only Pink Floor and Pink Spa, aiming to attract the growing market of female travellers in Sri Lanka and abroad.

title: Govt to recruit degree-holding professionals into teaching service
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake said the government plans to bring degree-holding professionals with teaching experience into the teaching service. He invited them to sit for the examination under the Sri Lanka Teachers Service Minute.

title: Temporary driving license service expanded to regional offices: DMT
byline: The Department of Motor Traffic (DMT) announced yesterday (2) that the facility to issue temporary driving licenses to foreign citizens, Sri Lankan citizens, and Sri Lankans with dual citizenship has been expanded to regional offices in Kurunegala, Hambantota, Gampaha, Anuradhapura, and Jaffna.

title: Rajeev Amarasuriya re-elected as BASL President
byline: Attorney-at-Law Rajeev Amarasuriya has been re-elected uncontested for a further term as President of the Bar Association of Sri Lanka (BASL) for the 2026/2027 period.

title: Speaker’s misbehaviour led to issue on Deputy Secretary General of Parliament: MP
byline: The misbehaviour of the Speaker had led to an unwanted issue with regard to the Deputy Secretary General of Parliament, MP Chamara Sampath Dassanayake told Parliament today.

title: Foreign digital creator claims Rs. 15,000 scam on first day in Colombo
byline: A foreign digital creator known as Travel with Balnur has alleged that she was scammed of Rs. 15,000 in Colombo on her first day in Sri Lanka, after being approached by a man who sought help citing personal hardships.

title: SLPP issues statement on Shiranthi Rajapaksa’s FCID summons
byline: The Sri Lanka Podujana Peramuna (SLPP) issued a statement this evening (03) in connection with the summoning of former First Lady Shiranthi Rajapaksa to the Financial Crimes Investigation Division (FCID).

title: Legal action planned against bakery in Mannar over food safety violations
byline: Public Health Inspectors attached to the Mannar Medical Officer of Health, along with the Municipal Public Health Inspector, inspected a bakery operating under the name Super Pannaye on February 3, 2026.

title: Special train services to facilitate devotees visiting Gangaramaya
byline: Sri Lanka Railways has arranged special train services to facilitate devotees travelling to Colombo to worship the sacred relics brought from India at the Hunupitiya Gangaramaya Temple.

title: Cabinet approves long-term contract for petrol supply
byline: The Cabinet of Ministers has approved the awarding of a long-term contract for the procurement of five shipments of Petrol 92 Octane Unleaded (92 Unl) to M/s Epdesa Pte. Ltd., following a competitive bidding process.
